Hyksos of typical Indo European stock:  
**Ratha** was a name prefix very prominent in the second millennium BC, as it was the name of drivers the newly invented bit-steered-chariot. (Ritter, rider, rad ğ“‡³ ray ğ’‹¥ rho Ï æ—¥ri)  

[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rhadamanthus](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rhadamanthus)  

Because of the Indian short vowel "Rtha" it entered Greece as 'ortho' 'artchie' 'archae' á¼ˆÏÏ‡Î¹Î¼Î®Î´Î·Ï‚ (Arkhimá¸—dÄ“s).  
It's meaning more or less preserved: right/rule á¼€ÏÏ‡ÏŒÏ‚ (arkhÃ³s) = leader (rex in latin). Order in english.  

Another 'indian' form **Raha** was further simplified into Ra'a or just Ray/Ra/Re: ğ“‡³  

The '[Menge](Menge)' root in Radhamanthys constituted some instance of 'Muchness': Big ruler, ruler of many, ruler of mankind or something similar.  

The '[Menge](Menge)' root was reduced to 'mega' in Greece, 'much' and 'measure' in English and [medi](medi):  
https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/Reconstruction:Proto-Indo-European/med-  

So Menge originally was more like Mendge similar to Menschen [mankind].  

In any case Archimedes was probably an echo, a reflection or just a corruption of Radhamanthys.  

How was this Hyksos name written in Hieroglyphs?  
**Radhamanthys**  
[[ğ“‡³] [ğ“‡‹](ğ“‡‹) [ğ“ ](ğ“ )[ğ“ˆ–](ğ“ˆ–) [ğ“·](ğ“·)  
Rath-aMen.tush  


He was the most prominent Egyptian ruler for the Greeks, who just dropped the 'Raha' title and called him 'Menes', just like the half-legendary Founding Father of Egypt:  https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Menes.  

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Amun
